Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was close to metro station (10 min walk). Rooms were clean and personnel very helpful from recommendations, information and guidelines. Good value for money. Pretty much what was described in hotel reviews we got it and even more.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome stay closer to the city”
Reviews.Author: Barry C
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about the Adagio Roma Gardens ApartHotel in Rome is that the apartment is quite large. However, it is old (décor, furnishings, kitchenette) and a little run down. I was surprised that it still met the usually high standards set by the Accor Group. It is also 13kms from the city centre and around 3 blocks from the Metro Train & Bus station. We didn't get to see how efficient the Rome Metro was to get around because there was a strike the day we needed to use it. Long way to walk to find the trains and buses not working! But apparantly public transport strikes in Rome are common and occur regularly! We were able to catch a taxi and the fact there was 4 of us meant it wasn't too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in the business quarters of Rome: EUR”
Reviews.Author: LucySatti
Reviews.Content: Booked a duplex for three person for four nights in Adagio Rome Garden and I found it fantastic: very tidy and spacious, with 2 separate bedrooms (a large one with twin beds + a smaller one with an individual bed), a big bathroom, a livingroom, a kitchinette and a terrace facing the famous Centro de la Civiltà del Lavoro. What else could three ladies wish for? :-) Location is very good: perfectly connected with Fiumicino, Ciampino and the city center via bus lines and Metro lines A and B. The closest subway stations are EUR Fermi and EUR Laurentina. In the surroundings there are a few restaurants and bars, a McDonalds, two supermarkets and Gay Village (for those interested in this aspect). In the immediate vicinity of Adagio Rome Garden there are a few museums/centers/churches as well: - The Roman Civilization Museum - The Planetarium - The Prehistoric Musuems - The Traditional Popular Arts Museum - Le Colisé Carré (Centro de la Civiltà del Lavoro) - St. Peter and St. Paul Basilic The service was impeccable! No flaw. The receptionists are multilingual, hospital and very helpful. Upon request they provide maps, brochures and precious information on everything relating to Rome: seesighting, archaeology, restaurants and events. I rate this aparthotel excellent. TIP: For archaeology related info, ask the night audit Mahdi Fellak. He has the studies and expertise in the field, and avid researcher, and his info is far superior than a normal tour guide would ever provide you with. He speaks several languages (Italian, English, French and Arabic) as well.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: Nomad77_11
Reviews.Content: Overall I was satisfied with this place. Don't expect any luxury apartments here (it's more like an apartment-hotel), but for 3-4 nights it does the job perfectly and it's reasonably clean, cheap and comfortable. We did our booking for Rome late and didn't have much choice, also the same Adagio hotel Dehon was fully booked. Had the apartment for two, with the balcony. The view is not spectacular since it's in the EUR, i.e. the newer part of Rome, but still it was great to have a balcony to sit on. Transport - metro station is not too far from the hotel and very convenient when you go to the city centre, for 1 Euro. It's a long ride. However on the way back we always missed the last train so count on the taxi ride back to the hotel (20 Euros, but make sure you catch the official cab.) Rooms are not spectacular, but functional. Same applies for the bathroom. Internet was not free but it worked well for a small fee. What I loved the most was that the parking in front of the hotel was completely free, so we just parked the car there and enjoyed Rome by transport and on foot. They also have quadruple rooms so it's also something to consider when traveling in groups or for families.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment is clean,but far from main centre”
Reviews.Author: Sangs_143
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I stayed in this place from 31st Aug to 3rd Sep.. We truely enjoyed this place, the aprtment is big & we felt like home after a long day out in the sun. But we felt it would've been better if it was closer to city or little closer to public transport. thats the only complaint we had since we came from OZ & staying here for only 5 days & trying to see all monuments couldnt come home to rest in the afternoon..it was very hot , we had to finish the sight seeing & go to apartment only to retire. Another complaint we had is the staffs are totally help less, any information you ask they say they dont know. We couldnt get any information out of them about anything. This place is good if you are not rushing to see things in Rome & it is good for family stay..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good staff and good amenities at a reasonable price. I recommend this aparthotel. Location is good for EUR access and has good access to the metro and bus lines. Is in s quiet part of the city and direcrtly across from the Palaco de Congresso

Reviews.Title: “I liked it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Krishna2205
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its central location, proximity to the food joints, connectivity & proximity to our office in rome. I liked the Hotel for its spacious rooms, in room services, friendly & english speaking reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Work and pleasuere in Rome E.U.R.”
Reviews.Author: THEOCultureCoachEU
Reviews.Content: For my work as a teacher I stayed ten days in the hotel apartment. It was nearby “Liceo Ginnasio statale “Francesco Vivone”, the school we had a exchange project with. My colleague and I had an apartment in two floors. My colleague offered me the big sleeping room and she had two smaller sleeping rooms for her self. You easy can stay in this “two room” apartment with four persons if you want. The hotel in the E.U.R. district of Rome has a interesting history if you are interested, and closby the metro, four stops to Colloseum. Have no romantic ideas for staying. The hotel looks like unfinished my students say. Inside it is good and clean although two big towels for seven days is not enough. We complained about that. After a place worth to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a long stay in Rome if you don't mind the trip into the center.”
Reviews.Author: OldMaineTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 18 days at the Adagio Rome Garden in February and March 2010 for a leisurely return visit to Rome. We drove, so the free parking outside the building was a big convenience, allowing us to take day trips to the surrounding areas. We had a duplex suite for 69€ a night, a real bargain. It takes 20-30 minutes to get into the center by bus or Metro, but we did not mind. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel and we found the buses very convenient, also providing interesting views of the city. We got 7-day transit passes which allow unlimited rides, so we could jump on and off buses to get to various locations. By studying the bus map, we found we could get almost anywhere we wanted with one change. We liked having the kitchen because we could have breakfast in the room and sometimes a snack in the evening if we had had a big meal at midday, which was frequently the case, Not much in the immediate area, but just down the street are a supermarket and a good pastry and gelato shop. It is big office area so is very quiet at night. The staff tried to be as helpful as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Odd and quirky apartment hotel but don’t be put off”
Reviews.Author: Roga_Dogder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long period and have to say after initial concerns enjoyed my stay here. The hotel is a residence apartments with nearly all rooms being duplex comprising of kitchenette, hall, living room, bathroom and bedrooms, all with balconies or if on ground floor a patio garden. There are studio rooms which are one roomed affairs, I understand, and should be avoided for long term stays. Prices are very reasonable for an apartment per night, bearing in mind the large size of the apartment you get! Reception is extremely helpful and knowledgeable, with a large amount of information for the tourist to hand and to view. Taxis can be ordered and are very quick to turn up. There is free car parking in the hotel (are rarity here) and a superb Chinese / Japanese attached to the hotel building; the food is amazing, the best quality food and cooking I have had in years from a Chinese restaurant …and very reasonably priced. Try the Sweet and Sour chicken! The hotel, I assume, was built around the late 60’s, early 70’s. The apartment rooms are an oddity of a 60’s/70’s style and with a “Soviet flavour”. The furniture is old, again probably 70’s and the apartment rooms from level 2 and above are in need of refurbishment; certainly a lick of paint would not go amiss and an update. These rooms smell musty and this tends to get in ones clothes. For ground level to level 1 the rooms have has a lick of paint, tidied up plus nice kitchenettes! These are OK. There is self service laundry washing, drying (Washing 4 Euro, Drying 4 Euro…expensive!!) and ironing but buy your own washing liquid, etc. The soap tablets you can by from reception are next to useless! All rooms have a TV with Italian channels nearly all in the Italian language; odd seeing most of the guests are English speakers. Please note if you are in a rush to leave and want pay your bill, it would appear this could be time consuming if it is a large value amount! The location was OK for me as it is in a quiet area of an admin/ business district, with a number of good shops in Via Europe which is a 10 minute walk and other restaurants are near by. Also visit Euroma2 which is a 10 minute taxi ride (5 Euros), excellent shopping! Breakfast is provided next door in a bar/café at 3.5 Euros for a coffee and croissant, etc…expensive!! The also do good sandwiches, etc.

Reviews.Title: “been at Adagio City in September 2009. I...”
Reviews.Author: eduakira
Reviews.Content: been at Adagio City in September 2009. I choose this hotel as we have rented a car and isn't easy to try to find a hotel in city center with free parking. The hotel is at Eur district, an old business district that is alive by day and nearly desert by night, so there's no option for a meal by then. Rooms are wide, one living room and two bedrooms and a bathroom. Unfortunately it needs a refurbishment as soon as possible, decoration is very modern for 70's standards... But the room was clean. There's a tube station 3 blocks away and a good network of buses nearby. Some small supermarkets and a Mc Donald's nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid hotel due to theft problem”
Reviews.Author: sywu
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for proximity to convention center. However the room has no safe (as described in my reservation) and wireless is not compatible with Mac. I ended up using hotel lobby computer. One morning my digital SLR was stolen from my room around 7 am. Only people awake at that time are hotel staff including cleaning crew who have just arrived. After I made police report I realized that one of them is the likely culprit but I did not search the cleaning cart immediately following my discovery of theft. Also suspicious is the alteration of time of sign out for master key by that cleaning person from presumably before time of theft to after. That would not explain her presence outside my room before getting room key. Elevator was noisy and should alert thief to leave and missed stealing my zoom lens and laptop. When I presented above evidence to hotel manager, he refused to investigate. However he offered to compensate my loss from hotel insurance. After almost 5 months it appears to be empty promises. Hotel e-mail system blocks my e-mail attachments of camera invoice and he denies receiving camera invoice by fax or mail.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT service, and just good location”
Reviews.Author: ManuTheGreat
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and 2 friends of us (couple). First deception, despite the appartment being nice, big, clean, perfectly equipped, etc. there was only one big beed and then two small ones (in two separate rooms). Not really a big deal, but we would have liked to know it in advance. For families with children , it is perfect, though! I need to mention that the staff was just great. Very nice and polite, they were always ready to help you (to print boarding passes, to give you directions, advices, etc.). They speak all very good english and some very good french. It is in a quite boring neighbourhood (NOTHING to do there, just one bar downstairs, and closed on Sundays). But it is just 5 to 10 minutes walk to the metro station, and then 15 minutes to the Colosseum (around 40 minutes to the Vaticano). There is a night bus to get to the hotel from the city center when the tube has already closed, but we did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: tenaw
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome on 22 October 2007 and stayed in the Residence Garden Hotel for 4 nights. The staff are extremely polite and helpful. The hotel is situated between Fumicino Airport and Termini Station and also very close to the metro Line B. Therefore, it is an ideal location. The apartmnet is very spacious and the rooms are comfortable. It is an excellent hotel for families as well as for any one who wants a very good place to stay in Rome. I. Tenaou and family London, England

HotelInfo.Name: Adagio Rome Garden
HotelInfo.Address: Viale dell'Arte, 5A, 00144 Rome, Italy
